article_title: Peter Pomerantsev: From Russia, With Love For London
article_text:
The revolution in Kiev has turned from a story about Ukraine into a story about Russia and now, increasingly, into a story about London.

Even as the world was giggling over the zoos, private-car collection and faux Roman ruins of deposed Ukrainian President Viktor Yanukovych's palace of kitsch, Ukrainian journalists were pointing out that it had been part-owned by a U.K.-registered shell company. Separately, last week after Dmitry Firtash, a Ukrainian oligarch, was arrested in Vienna at the Federal Bureau of...

twitter.description: In The Wall Street Journal, Peter Pomerantsev writes that the city is a magnet for riches sometimes of dubious origin. That has its benefits—but now we're seeing the flip side.
twitter.title: From Russia, With Love For London
